shrimp.name: MKGooch
shrimp.author: rconstruct

input.name: B
input.description: Used to construct the cool color

input.name: Y
input.description: Used to contruct the warm color

shrimp.usage: Gooch non photorealistic shading model, by Mike King, as described in an "A Non-Photorealistic Lighting Model for Automatic Technical Illustration", in the Siggraph 1998 proceedings. "Ka", "Kd", "Ks", are the ambient, diffuse, and specular coefficients respectively, with "alpha" and "beta", the Gooch cool and warm color factors. "B" and "Y" are used to contruct the cool and warm color, and "roughness" and "Cspec", to control the apparent specular roughness and specular color respectively. This block passes the resulting values to the "aov_surfacecolor", "aov_ambient", "aov_diffuse", "aov_specularcolor" and "aov_specular" AOV presets. The "category" variable defines the light categories used for the "illuminance" construct of this block.
